entry.title: 2023 Chicago Marathon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that four course records were broken during the 2023 Chicago Marathon (women's winner pictured)?

entry.title: Maryam Eslamdoust (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Maryam Eslamdoust was the first Iranian-born woman to hold public office in Great Britain?

entry.title: Pitfall! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that you can play Pitfall! in two Call of Duty games?

entry.title: Nikolauskirche (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on Christmas Eve in 1818, the Christmas carol "Stille Nacht" ("Silent Night") was first performed in the Nikolauskirche in Oberndorf, Austria?

entry.title: National War Labor Board (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the tripartite structure of the National War Labor Board helped the United States keep work stoppages to a minimum during World War II?

entry.title: Willem Lange (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that on every Christmas Eve since 1994, Willem Lange's story about the fruitcake-delivering farmer Favor Johnson is broadcast on public radio stations in Vermont?

entry.title: Ligue de défense de la race nègre (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the anti-colonialist Ligue de défense de la race nègre, which at one point had around 1,000 members, was suppressed by the French government in 1937, ten years after its founding?

entry.title: Mel Bartholomew (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mel Bartholomew, who developed the time-saving square foot gardening method, said that he gardened "with a salad bowl in mind, not a wheelbarrow"?
